```{r numbering tables,include=FALSE}
#tables
table_nums <- captioner::captioner(prefix = "Table")

tab.1_cap <- table_nums(name = "tab_1", 
                        caption = "Here is a regular old table. This one I created manually using markdown")
tab.2_cap <- table_nums(name = "tab_2", 
                        caption = "Sometimes tables are too large and need to be oriented as landscape. Here is an example of a complex table from an R chunk.")

t.ref <- function(x) {
  stringr::str_extract(table_nums(x), "[^:]*")
}

  #inline example  text `r t.ref("tab_1")` more text
```

```{r numbering figures,include=FALSE}
#figures
fig_nums <- captioner::captioner(prefix = "Figure")

fig.1_cap <- fig_nums(name = "fig_1", 
                        caption = "You can create any figure you want within your document.")
fig.2_cap <- fig_nums(name = "fig_2", 
                        caption = "You can call an previously created figure from a sourced file.")

f.ref <- function(x) {
  stringr::str_extract(fig_nums(x), "[^:]*")
}

  #inline example  text `r f.ref("fig_1")` more text
```

## Results   
Using `r print("inline code")`, we can include just about anything! I can include a number (n=`r n`), or compute a range from a subset (`r n-1 - n^2`). These are really useful when you go back and make changes to your original Rscripts! No need to update numbers or references by hand. Mathematical equations are easy too! (insert equation here). We can again reference our table (`r t.ref("tab_2")`) and figure (`r f.ref("fig_2")`).

## Figures


```{r,fig.height=6,fig.width=5,echo=FALSE}
colrs <- c("group 1"="black", "group 2"="red")

ggplot() + 
  geom_polygon(data = americas.df, aes(x = long, y = lat,group=group),fill="grey90") +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = (-6:6) * 10,
                     labels = c("60ºS", "50ºS", "40ºS","30ºS", 
                                "20ºS", "10ºS", "0ºN", "10ºN", 
                                "20ºN","30ºN", "40ºN", "50ºN", "60ºN")) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = (-12:-4) * 10,
                     labels = c("120ºW","110ºW", "100ºW", "90ºW",
                                "80ºW", "70ºW", "60ºW","50ºW", "40ºW"))+ 
  labs(y="",x="")+
  coord_map("azequalarea", orientation = c(0, -90, 0))+
geom_point(data=points.df, aes(x=lon, y=lat,color=group), alpha = .5,size=1.4,pch=16)+  
  scale_fill_manual(values = colrs, name="GROUP")+
  theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white", colour = "grey"), 
        panel.grid.major = element_line(colour = "grey90"),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(), 
        axis.text.x = element_text (size = 10, vjust = 0), 
        axis.text.y = element_text (size = 10, hjust = 1.3),
        legend.position=c(.2, .3)) + coord_cartesian(xlim = longlimits, ylim = latlimits) 
```
